titleStmt.title: Freeland Jackson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5585

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: His Excellency Thos E Bramlett Govnor of the Commonwelth of Kentucky would Respectfully Represent to your Excellency that Freeland Jackson a youth of about 14 years old at the time was persuaded off by a Band of Merauders against His fathers will & was Hid and kept out of the way of His father Control that Said Band is acused of Divers thefts and no Indictment against said Boy But is forfeit the will be He asks your Excellency to pardon Him He Claims that He never done any thing But was with them a short Time His father and family is Respectfully able and Reside in Bath County He prays your Excellency to Extend Him the Benefit of the Executive Clemency and grant him a full pardon for the above offences

the petitioners names
Elder :Jas: Adams
Robert Frisby
Samuel Power
Sanford Power
John T faudere
R W Walker
W. S. Pierce
G. W. McCormick
Edward Power
John T Power
James F. Morrison
Ben Power
Salomon Rathwell
Wm.. Rathwell
Nathaniel Alexander
Robert Wigington
T N Perry
C M Hanks
J. W. Moore by Hanks
Joseph H Johnson
Francis Johnson
Until an accusation is made either in the form of Warrant or Indictment no Pardon can be made to apply-
